page.title: 12ECOLOGY
page.content: There are many mineshafts in the area,many mapped and some unmapped. Most shafts are{500m deep. The area had to be surveyed to note all of the shafts and aerial photographs were also taken. They found{2,300 shafts}altogether. Some were very dangerous because they were hidden by the trees and shrubbery. Some could not be filled with cement because of the working mine nearby, also because of their depth or the importance of the drainage in the area. Part of the mineshafts were dug out until they hit some solid rock. Some{steel girders}were placed across the shafts. They placed some cement on top of the girders and a{large steel {mesh cone}was placed on top of that. Some shafts had the{Greater Horseshoe {bat}living in them between 15m and 60m deep in the mine.
